faqs.question: Does Shopify automatically create redirects?
faqs.answer: Yes, Shopify automatically creates 301 redirects when you change product or collection handles. However, if you delete and recreate a product with a different handle, or make certain bulk changes, you must manually create redirects. Always verify automatic redirects were created using our checker tool.

faqs.question: How many redirects can I have on Shopify?
faqs.answer: Shopify's redirect limit varies by plan. Basic plans typically allow fewer redirects than Advanced or Plus plans. Check your current limit in the Shopify admin. If you need more redirects, consider using a third-party redirect app or upgrading your plan.

faqs.question: Can I create 302 temporary redirects on Shopify?
faqs.answer: No, Shopify's built-in redirect system only supports 301 permanent redirects. If you need temporary redirects for campaigns or A/B testing, you'll need to use a third-party Shopify app that supports 302 redirects.

faqs.question: How do I redirect my old domain to Shopify?
faqs.answer: When migrating to Shopify from another platform, set up your custom domain in Shopify settings, then redirect your old domain using your domain registrar's redirect settings. Create individual page redirects in Shopify's URL redirect manager to map old product/collection URLs to new Shopify URLs.

faqs.question: Will changing product URLs hurt my SEO on Shopify?
faqs.answer: If properly redirected using 301 redirects, changing product URLs preserves 90-99% of SEO value. Shopify's automatic redirect creation helps, but always verify redirects are working and monitor rankings for a few weeks after changes. Avoid frequent URL changes when possible.

faqs.question: How do I bulk import redirects to Shopify?
faqs.answer: Create a CSV file with two columns: 'Redirect from' and 'Redirect to'. Include only the path portion (e.g., /products/old-item), not the full URL. Go to Online Store > Navigation > URL Redirects, click Import, and upload your CSV. Shopify will process and create the redirects.

faqs.question: Can I redirect Shopify URLs to external websites?
faqs.answer: Shopify's built-in redirect system doesn't support redirecting to external domains. You'll need to use a third-party redirect app or Shopify Scripts (Shopify Plus only) to redirect to external sites. For most cases, it's better to keep redirects within your store.

faqs.question: What happens to Shopify redirects if I change themes?
faqs.answer: Redirects are stored in Shopify's database, not in themes, so they persist across theme changes. However, theme changes might alter URL structure for blogs or pages, requiring new redirects. Always test your site after theme changes and create any necessary new redirects.

faqs.question: How do I fix redirect chains on Shopify?
faqs.answer: Redirect chains occur when you change a product handle multiple times (A→B→C). To fix, update the original redirect to point directly to the final destination (A→C). Use our redirect checker to identify chains, then manually update redirects in Shopify's URL redirect manager.

faqs.question: Should I use a Shopify redirect app?
faqs.answer: Use a redirect app if you need: unlimited redirects (beyond Shopify's plan limit), 302 temporary redirects, wildcard/regex patterns, 404 monitoring, or detailed redirect analytics. For basic redirect needs, Shopify's built-in redirect manager is sufficient and free.
